abstract: An accounting charge related to Microsoft’s acquisition of an online advertising business led to a rare quarterly loss for the software giant. Revenue from Windows declined.
snippet: An accounting charge related to Microsoft’s acquisition of an online advertising business led to a rare quarterly loss for the software giant. Revenue from Windows declined.
lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — An accounting charge related to Microsoft’s ill-fated acquisition of an online advertising business led to a loss for the software giant’s last quarter, its first in more than two decades as a public company.

headline.main: Microsoft Reports Loss After a Write-Down
